summary: An FBI Guardian Complaint Form dated October 18, 2021, summarizing a report from an attorney for the Virgin Islands Attorney General. The attorney relayed accusations of violent rape against Jes Staley by two women and alleged that Jeffrey Epstein's attorney and accountant were aware of and helped cover up his crimes.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The central subject of the investigation; his estate is being investigated by the Virgin Islands Attorney General for child sex trafficking.

persons.name: Jes Staley
persons.context: Accused by two women of violent rape; the accusations were relayed to the FBI by an attorney investigating the Epstein estate.

persons.name: Attorney General of Virgin Islands
persons.context: The office conducting an investigation against the Jeffrey Epstein estate; an outside counsel for this office contacted the FBI.

connections.description: Staley is accused of violent rape in the context of an investigation into Epstein's activities, suggesting a potential association within the same circles.
Epstein's attorney is alleged to have been aware of his activities and helped cover up the crimes.
Epstein's accountant is alleged to have been aware of his activities and helped cover up the crimes.

events.title: FBI Complaint Filed Regarding Staley Accusations
events.description: An attorney for the Virgin Islands AG contacted the FBI to report accusations of violent rape against Jes Staley by two women and to allege that Epstein's attorney and accountant helped cover up crimes.

keyFacts: Two women have accused Jes Staley, CEO of Barclays Bank, of violent rape.
One of the women believes she previously reported these accusations to the FBI.
An investigation into the Jeffrey Epstein estate uncovered information suggesting Epstein's attorney and accountant were aware of his activities and helped cover them up.
The report was filed via an FBI Guardian Complaint Form by an outside counsel for the Virgin Islands Attorney General.
The document indicates ongoing investigative interest in Epstein's network beyond his death.
